page.title: 11FISH MARKET
page.content: Once the fish are landed from the trawlers they are stored in locally made boxes with protective ice.The fish market comes to life around 4am. That's when Aberdeen's 200 fish workers start unloading the fish. Then the fish are weighed and laid out in display boxes for the buyers to inspect them.The auction starts at 7.30am and may continue until midday. The port handles mainly haddock.Once sold the fish are then gutted and none is wasted.After filleting the trimmings,head,tail, scales and bones are frozen into blocks for export to Scandinavia.There, the fish offal is processed into mink food.Another export is fish meal which is mainly used as an additive to animal feed. There are still a few remaining kilns on the quays for smoking kippers and haddock producing the famous 'Smokie'.
